projects.name: Interface Research Lab
projects.short_description: A technology education and digital fabrication lab in Beacon, NY
projects.description:
Motivation

This effort is motivated by a desire to help prepare the Beacon, NY community for the future of work and industry through education in the concepts and tools of modern technology and participation in an exploratory process of new, local industry creation.

Mission

The Interface Research Lab will exist to:
  1. Nurture the creative, productive, and economic potential of the local community through technology education and access to tools, with a focus on invention and innovation, product design, open-source ethos, collaborative economics, and ecological sustainability
  2. Provide public access to digital resources and community information
  3. Research and develop products, processes, and services, as well as applying existing research, in support of our educational and community access directives

More info at: irl.beaconny.net

images.name: Interface Research Lab logo
images.description: A picture of the Interface Research Lab logo

projects.name: X-ray Painter
projects.short_description: Experimental video paintings using a camera, projector, and custom video effects.
projects.description: I created these video paintings in the course of setting up various components for a different, future interactive video project. When the video filter detects motion via the camera input, it changes the output pixels from black to white in the region where motion was detected. Since the detection area of the camera and projection area of the projector are not calibrated, the change in output resulting from an initial motion event causes a cascade of synthetic motion events that result in interesting generative forms. The video filter also implements a horizontal mirror effect for pleasing symmetry.

projects.name: Static Site Generator
projects.short_description: The application that builds derekenos.com.

images.name: Static Site Generator
images.description: A picture of the Static Site Generator

projects.description:
I built this static website generator to maintain my personal website, derekenos.com.

It's relatively simple, has accessibility, SEO best practices, and structured data (via Open Graph tags and Microdata markup) built in, supports cloud object storage for large static files, and has a live-reload feature for more joyful local development.

projects.name: HTMLephant
projects.short_description: A small and lazy HTML generator.
projects.description: HTMLephant is a lazy, class-based, Python HTML generator that I made because it seemed fun and is now used extensively by my static website generator. The generated output is well-formed and pleasantly human-readable - just take a look (right-click ⇒ View Page Source) at this page's source!

images.name: HTMLephant
images.description: A picture of the HTMLephant

projects.name: femtoweb
projects.short_description: An asynchronous HTTP server and web application framework.
projects.description: I made femtoweb because I needed a small HTTP server and web application framework for my various Micropython / ESP32-based IOT projects. At the time there was picoweb, but this required use of the pycopy Micropython fork, and I wanted to use stock, mainline Micropython. After asyncio made its way into Micropython, I refactored this library to use it. It does exactly what I need it to and nothing more. 👍

images.name: femtoweb
images.description: A picture of the femtoweb

projects.description: This project explores using low-cost, commodity components to create custom physical interfaces. This initial version is built into a cardboard box and uses household light switches and dimmer knobs as inputs, and an Amazon Fire tablet running a full-screen web browser as the display. The inputs are attached via alligator clips to a battery-powered, breadboarded ESP32-PICO-KIT that communicates input state changes to the Fire Tablet via WiFi.
